intro: Agelaea elegans, commonly known as the elegant agelaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Agelaea elegans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
